text: Why is my bubble sort in Python so slow?
I have the following code thats use bubble sort to invert a list and has a worst time performance:

code:
for i in xrange(len(l)):
    for j in xrange(len(l)):
        if l[i]>l[j]:
            l[i], l[j] = l[j], l[i]

text: In some cases (when len(l) = 100000) the code spend more then 2h to complete execute, I think its so strange, please correct my code or give some suggestions.
numpy and numarray solutions are welcome.
